summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons medical emergency report detailing the response to Jeffrey Epstein being found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019. It records the resuscitation efforts performed by correctional officers and medical staff, noting his condition upon discovery and his subsequent transport to a local emergency room.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The subject of the medical emergency and resuscitation efforts.

persons.name: Joseph Colombo
persons.context: The RN who generated the consultation request form for Epstein's transfer to the emergency room.

persons.name: Sabi
persons.context: Listed as a team member/provider in the clinical encounter note for the resuscitation event.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive on the floor of his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. Correctional officers initiated CPR. He was cold, had circumferential bruising around the neck, posterior mottling, fixed and dilated pupils, and no palpable pulses.

events.title: Resuscitation Attempt and Transport
events.description: Medical staff and paramedics performed extensive resuscitation efforts including CPR, AED (no shock advised), intubation, and administration of epinephrine and sodium bicarbonate. Epstein remained in asystole and was transported to a local emergency room with CPR in progress.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 6:33 a.m. on August 10, 2019.
Upon discovery, he had 'circumferential bruising around the neck' and 'posterior mottling'.
All resuscitation efforts, including CPR, defibrillation (no shock advised), intubation, and medication, were unsuccessful; he remained in asystole.
He was transported to a local emergency room with CPR still in progress at approximately 7:10 a.m.
The document is a contemporaneous medical record of the immediate response to Epstein's death in custody.
